meanings.definition: A small, round, flat cake made of sweetened dough.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious didie at the bakery.
meanings.sent2: My mom baked some didies for my birthday party.
meanings.sent3: The didie looked too cute to eat, like a tiny edible frisbee.
meanings.sent4: The didie was a sweet little disc of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly baked didie filled the room.

meanings.definition: To move quickly or suddenly in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The cat didied across the room to catch the toy.
meanings.sent2: I didie to the door when I heard the doorbell ring.
meanings.sent3: I didie past my brother in a race to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel didied up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent5: The ball didied back and forth between the players.

meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm was accompanied by a loud didie.
meanings.sent2: I heard a strange didie coming from the old house.
meanings.sent3: The didie of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The didie of the car horn startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected didie made me spill my drink.
